newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria c.bank corrects interest rate to 9.76 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria c.bank corrects interest rate to 9.76 pct.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank on Friday corrected its new main annual interest rate to 9.76 percent from the 9.56 percent it announced on Thursday, a BNB spokesman said.

"There was a technical error in the interest rate cut announcement yesterday. The correct simple main annual interest rate is 9.76 percent, from 10.12 percent now," BNB spokesman Kostadin Georgiev told Reuters. The new rate is effective from July 7.
A BNB statement on Thursday said the bank had set the main simple annual rate at 9.56 percent as of July 7.
The rate is calculated on the average yield to maturity on three-month discount T-bills, which was 2.46 percent for bills auctioned on Monday.
A week ago the BNB set the simple main rate at 10.12 percent, shadowing excessive lev liqidity on the domestic money market.

Interest rates have come down to 0.81 percent monthly from 18 percent in March, reflecting a stabilising trend in the economy after an IMF reform and funding deal reached in March. On Tuesday Bulgaria launched a restrictive fixed exchange rate regime aimed at restoring confidence in the financial system.
